poem:
"Generosity In the Morning"

From the window, I see no soldiers, no conflict, 
Only the sparrows, swift in their city caucus.
Yet, in rooms of marble, hands of power and intent 
Weave threads of gold across map-lines.
A kindness measured in billions, a hope packed in envelopes.
Democracy with her maidservant, Unity, coming to rescue
One, holding an olive branch heavy with promise.
